jobsJson.descriptionPlain:
Gojek is the fastest growing technology company in Indonesia and is rapidly expanding regionally across SE Asia. The company operates a consumer on-demand application that serves four key verticals: (i) transportation, (ii) food delivery, (iii) logistics and (iv) payments (GoPay). Key investors currently include Google, Temasek / GIC, Tencent, KKR, Warburg Pincus, Sequoia and Visa.

You will be reporting directly to the Group Head of Tax and be an integral part of the group tax function. As the primary indirect tax expert within the tax function, you will need to collaborate with tax team members throughout the group.

jobsJson.additionalPlain:
Gojek is a technology startup based in Jakarta, Indonesia. Specialising in ride-hailing and logistics, we are also the only company in Southeast Asia to be part of Fortune's 50 Companies That Changed the World (2017).

Gojek is a Super App: one app with over 20 services including food delivery, commuting, digital payments, shopping, hyper-local delivery, massages, and many more.

Gojek is Indonesia’s first and fastest growing unicorn building an on-demand empire. Our total of 2,000,000 driver-partners collectively travel 16.5 million KM daily – making us Indonesia’s de-facto transportation choice.

Gojek is a verb! Gojek is a way of life!

lists.content:
• Overall responsibility for indirect tax matters, including compliance, consulting, tax disputes and all other related matters.
  • Aligning with and supporting local in- country tax managers to provide oversight and ensure consistency across entities with respect to indirect tax matters
  • Provide indirect tax support to the business, including research, providing advice, and assisting with implementation.
  • Support business growth by evaluating and managing indirect tax risk for new business initiatives and new/amended product launches.
  • Develop, implement and oversee indirect tax controls and processes.
  • Monitor and assess new tax legislation and case law for applicability and communicate changes and impact to the business.
  • Make recommendations regarding the use of external advisors, and manage those advisors.

• 6-8 years indirect tax experience, covering South East Asia jurisdictions
  • Preferably a combination of experience from the industry and Big 4 firm.
  • Solid understanding of international indirect tax concepts.
  • Strong written and verbal communications skills.
  • A team player that is used to operating cross-functionally and cross-jurisdiction/culture.
  • Ability to work in a fast-paced, rapidly changing, and high-growth organization.
  • Open to challenging projects outside areas of experience or comfort zone.
